vague_description: Decide the optimal mix of lights to install while meeting constraints on minimum number of lights, electricity usage, and specific lamp type requirements.
detailed_description: A lighting company has access to two types of lights to provide their customers, an LED fixture, and a fluorescence lamp. The LED light uses \param{ELed} units of electricity per hour and needs to be changed \param{NLed} times a decade. Conversely, the fluorescence lamp uses \param{EFluorescence} units of electricity per hour and needs to be changed \param{NFluorescence} times a decade. Due to previous installations, at least \param{PFluorescence} implemented lights must be fluorescence lamps. If the customer requires at least \param{MinLights} light fixtures and can use at most \param{MaxElectricity} units of electricity, how many of each light should be installed to reduce the total number of light changes?
target_objective: Minimize the total number of light changes over a decade
target_constraints: At least PFluorescence fluorescence lamps must be installed
At least MinLights light fixtures are required in total
No more than MaxElectricity units of electricity can be used per hour
Number of LED lights is non-negative
Number of fluorescence lamps is non-negative
target_parameters: Electricity used per hour by an LED light
Times an LED light needs to be changed per decade
Electricity used per hour by a fluorescence lamp
Times a fluorescence lamp needs to be changed per decade
Minimum percentage of lights that must be fluorescence lamps
Minimum number of light fixtures required
Maximum units of electricity that can be used
